intro: Haloragis secunda, commonly known as the slender willowherb, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland or aquatic environments, often found in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats. The plant has slender, erect stems that are often covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are linear to lanceolate in shape. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom during the spring and summer months. Haloragis secunda plays an important role in stabilizing shorelines and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
